title: Const fields don't have offsets
body:
- Il2CppDumper version: 6.7.25

- Target Unity version: Unity Version 202, Il2cpp Version 27.1

- Describe the issue: I was curious why const fields don't have offsets (I'm pretty sure they can still be modified in memory, so I don't see why not). For example,
`private const int TOKEN_NONE = 0;` does not have an offset, while
`protected static int lastErrorIndex; // 0x0` does.
This probably isn't Il2cppDumper's fault, but I'm curious about it. It's also a little annoying because I believe const fields can still be modified in memory.

- Upload executable file and global-metadata.dat: The example was from Pixel Gun 3D 16.6.1, but it should occur on all games. I could not upload executable and metadata because the file size is too big.
author: HorridModz

comments.body: Constants have no offset, they are directly replaced with concrete values at compile time.

title: [FEATURE] Show address of generic implementations
body:
Hello, I would like to ask you if it's possible to get address of generic implementations inside il2cpp dump?

Example, if I have the following dump:
```
public interface ExampleInterface 
{
    // RVA: -1 Offset: -1 Slot: 0
    public abstract Out ExampleFunction<In, Out>(In arg);
    /* GenericInstMethod :
    |
    |-RVA: -1 Offset: -1
    |-ExampleInterface.ExampleFunction<int, string>      <--- is it possible to get RVA for these?
    |-ExampleInterface.ExampleFunction<object, object>   <--- 
    ...
}
```

I don't know if this information is present in metadata itself, but I think it would be a great feature for reverse-engineering.

Thank you :D
author: jorgschulze73

comments.body: What you are looking at is the abstract function of the interface, you should look for the implementation of the interface.

title: Question regarding readme and the DummyDLLs
body:
In the readme, you specify that the DummyDLLs that this program generates can be used with UTinyRipper to extract MonoBehaviours and other things from the game's asset files. I have used this tool successfully against a game that I want to analyse (and maybe mod later down the track...) and got a dump of the DummyDLLs which I thought included the code from the game, however they are just empty shells (as the name suggests, dummies).

Can UTinyRipper use the DummyDLLs to "reconstruct"/dump the scripts in the game with code, or would it just restore the MonoBehaviours as empty shells? I suppose it's probably hard to interpret the C++ that the IL2CPP part of Unity creates into usable scripts, so you can kinda get a glimpse of the game's code structure but other than that, you don't have the full source code so-to-speak.

Cheers!
author: SoftwareGuy

comments.body: In the il2cpp environment, only the structure of MonoBehaviour can be restored. It is useful for viewing specific data in MonoBehaviour, such as ScriptableObject, if you need code, you can only view it through ida and write it manually.

title: Game was protected. But cannot dump it. Is there anyway to solve?
body:
Dear everyone,

I got a game which protected binary file. But when i use gameguardian to dump it, game crash immediately. Is there anyway to bypass this?

Please help me
author: mrcas

comments.body: Please confirm that you have checked the gameguardian hidden.

I tried lot of ways but still cannot do anything. Or maybe i do something wrong.

I tried to freeze the game when dump. But the dump file is not correct. I want to learn new experience to solve this case. Please help me.

I have tested that if check the 4 hidden options of gameguardian, can dump normally.
But for the file after dump, you need to copy the elf header from the source so file, then edit the PHT header, set the offset and vaddr values of the two Loadable Segments to 0, and set filesz and memsz to the so file size.
Thanks for your help. I solved it.

Dear Perfare,

Sorry for disturbing you. I noticed that after dump, i just need to edit ELF header and Il2CppDumper can dump normally. Is it any wrong? It seems this game have anti patch too. When i patched in runtime, game freezed.
Thanks again Perface. I solved the problem now :D. Thanks for teaching me.
Okay, I will close this issue. If you have other issues, you can open a new.

title: 在script.json中，添加方法的结束地址。
body:
在老版本中 script.py中会有MakeFunction(0x1001237A4, 0x10012381C)字段，可以根据方法的起始地址查询到结束地址。
而在新版script.json中，只有一个Addresses存储全部地址，
能否将结束地址直接添加到ScriptMethod对应的方法中
author: Upfunny

comments.body: 首先这个地址并不是100%正确的地址，只是把il2cpp函数的地址排了个序，其次，script.json中的Addresses数组就是原本的MakeFunction所使用的地址，我只是把它放到了json中。

title: Sequence contains no matching element
body:
- Il2CppDumper version: v6.2.1
- Unity version: 2017.4.35f1
- Describe the issue: Sequence contains no matching element
- Upload executable file and global-metadata.dat: uploaded here: www.mediafire.com/file/8wieil260mgl5ee/s.7z/file

Some more info:

When I tried it on the libil2cpp.so from the apk, it said the file may be protected, so I dumped the memory using game guardian. The map said the following ranges were relevant

````
08000000-08005000 r--p 00000000 08:13 308        lib/arm/libil2cpp.so
08005000-0800a000 rw-p 00005000 08:13 308        lib/arm/libil2cpp.so
0800a000-084b1000 r--p 0000a000 08:13 308        lib/arm/libil2cpp.so
084b1000-0b0bf000 rw-p 004b1000 08:13 308        lib/arm/libil2cpp.so
0b0bf000-0b4a7000 r--p 030bf000 08:13 308        lib/arm/libil2cpp.so
0b4a7000-0b4b0000 r--p 00000000 00:00 0 
0b4b0000-0b795000 rw-p 034b0000 08:13 308        lib/arm/libil2cpp.so
0b795000-0b817000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0 
0b817000-0b824000 r--p 00000000 00:00 0 
0b824000-0b825000 rw-p 03794000 08:13 308        lib/arm/libil2cpp.so
0b825000-0b834000 r--p 00000000 00:00 0 
0b834000-0b844000 r--p 03794000 08:13 308        lib/arm/libil2cpp.so
0b844000-0b85f000 r--p 00000000 00:00 0 
0b85f000-0b8e1000 rw-p 037af000 08:13 308        lib/arm/libil2cpp.so
0b8e1000-0c000000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0 
````

And there was one big file called 08000000-0c000000 so I copied it over.
When I ran Il2CppDumper again, it said it wasn't supported.

I opened the file and did a search for ELF and noticed there were a bunch of null bytes before it, so I deleted those. This time, it detected it as a dump file and asked for the offset.

I typed 0 as the offset, and then got the error message.
author: MxyL

comments.body: 08000000 is the offset
According to my test, if you have no problem with dumping, this protection is temporarily not supported, you can try to dump from arm64 device.

title: Current master vs 6.2.1
body:
Unity v24.1

I've been working on a new type of export so I used master as a starting point. But there have been some changes in the way generic functions are exported.

For example, in the current v6.2.1 release the script.json file has:
    {
      "Address": 41838464,
      "Name": "Method$Client.App.SingleInstance<AppModel>.get_Instance()",
      "MethodAddress": 21284416
    },

While the master branch has this:
    {
      "Address": 41838464,
      "Name": "Method$Client.App.SingleInstance<AppModel>.get_Instance()",
      "MethodAddress": 0
    },

It can't seem to find the MethodAddress in this case. But with some "Method$" it still finds the address. The difference was in where it was used. The foreach (var i in metadata.metadataUsageDic[3]) loop is fine (all methodDef's have a methodIndex). But the foreach (var i in metadata.metadataUsageDic[6]) is different, none of the methodDef's have a methodIndex (all -1). 

This also causes some functions to be missing (probably functions that aren't found due to the above).
author: Da-Teach

comments.body: Now the master is not finished, so it has not been released. I am now perfecting the generic function part so that it can handle the rgctxs. In fact, il2cpp will generate a function for each generic function instance, so there is no address for the T parameter function.

No Need To Use Hex Editor, Since you dump from memory the il2cpp already unprotected, you just need loaded in Il2cpp Dumper

> 
> 
> > so after i dump the il2copp from memory and get all classes and functions then how to modify the protected file with hex editor any idea cause it is protected
> 
> No Need To Use Hex Editor, Since you dump from memory the il2cpp already unprotected, you just need loaded in Il2cpp Dumper

His mean that after using II2cppdumper, get all files. But when we find the offset to patch, how can we patch it? Because the il2cpp.so file is protected. Can we patch directly to original .so file?
Please. Help us!

> Please. Help us!

i guess you cant but you must make a shared library .so with mono loader and load it into game process and call functions from there
Thanks my friend, i see and i also though same with you.
Using VirtualApp or Riru to modify libil2cpp.so at runtime, you need to have certain C programming knowledge, I will not do too much introduction here, please rely on your own.

title: Cannot edit methods, classes in extracted dll files
body:
Hello,

When editing shows me this message..



**the predefined type 'system.object' is not defined or imported**


- Although adding a simple space shows me this error, that is, I cannot modify the code

I use the dnSpy decompiler
author: teamjrmods

comments.body: lol, do not edit dump dll files
It's just a fake dll, there is no code in it, why should you edit it?

title: i cant run the script.py in IDA
body:
hello
i need some help to run script.py in IDA
the Il2CppDumper-v4.2.3 script in run normal on my IDA
but the Il2CppDumper-v5.xx > v6 i cant run there script
can you give me some info how to make the script works
 my ida is 6.8
thank you have nice day
author: mareyole

comments.body:
Does not support ida 6.8, please use version 7.0 and above.
#249

title: No Values
body:
- Il2CppDumper version
latest
- Target Unity version
2019.2

- Describe the issue
I can see all the classes and fields but no values.

- Upload executable file and global-metadata.dat
author: brunovarelaAptoide

comments.body: Can't understand what you're talking about.

In the generated dump you can get the the variables names but how can I get the variable values?
Example:
private static byte[] data; // 0x58F8 -> how can I get the value of this variable?
I don't know if you want to get the value at runtime or something else, you need to describe your problem in detail.

The information we get on the dumper file is:
- Methods,Classes,Variables Name,Offsets etc.

Besides this information can we get the variables value on the execution of the dumper?

Thank you for your answers btw.
I think you lack some knowledge, the value of variables can be changed at runtime, they may not have a fixed value.
You're right, the value can change, however I'm interested in the value that is assigned in compile time to specific variables. Am I able to obtain that using your tool?
Go to the .cctor function of the static class to see the value of the variable initialization.

What do you mean by the static class? the Dump.cs?We have this in the dumper file:

	private static byte[] data; // 0x58F8
	public static readonly bool IsPopulated; // 0xC0000

	// Methods
	public static byte[] Data(); // RVA: 0x1024964 Offset: 0x1024964
	public void .ctor(); // RVA: 0x1024B28 Offset: 0x1024B28
	private static void .cctor(); // RVA: 0x1024B54 Offset: 0x1024B54

Is this .cctor() ?
The problem is how can I find .cctor() code?
Use ida or other decompiler.

title: GUI
body: Hi! How can i call GUI.Label from c++ code?
author: shazgames1

comments.body: Use a hook to inject code into a function of a class that has 'OnGUI' function, and do what you want.

title: Il2cpp Replica of Nested classes
author: PiotrKFtw

comments.body: If you want to create an instance of a class, using ```il2cpp_runtime_class_init(Il2CppClass* klass)```, The pointer to Il2CppClass can be found in script.py like ```Class$GUILayoutGroup.LayoutCache```

> If you want to create an instance of a class, using , The pointer to Il2CppClass can be found in script.py like `Class$GUILayoutGroup.LayoutCache`

Doesn't work

```il2cpp_class_from_name``` function prototype is ```Il2CppClass* il2cpp_class_from_name(const Il2CppImage* image, const char* namespaze, const char *name)```, confirm that you provided the correct parameters.

> `il2cpp_class_from_name` function prototype is `Il2CppClass* il2cpp_class_from_name(const Il2CppImage* image, const char* namespaze, const char *name)`, confirm that you provided the correct parameters.

Confirmed.
I can't help you more, but I think the ```Class$GUILayoutGroup.LayoutCache``` address in script.py is the pointer to the Il2CppClass you want.
I haven't received your reply in a week. I think you have solved this problem. If you have other questions, you can reopen it or create a new one. I will answer you within the scope of my ability.
